alert.note: Alert for Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 5:49PM MDT until August 24 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected on the Medio burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following county, Santa Fe. * WHEN...Until 745 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the Medio burn area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pojoaque, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Nambe Pueblo, Nambe Lake, Pojoaque Pueblo and Chupadero. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
